      • onCommitContent

        public void onCommitContent(android.support.v13.view.inputmethod.InputContentInfoCompat inputContentInfo)
        This handler is called by the input method to commit content such as a PNG and GIF image to the editor. When the user selects an image, the IME calls commitContent() and sends an InputContentInfo to the editor. The commitContent() call is analogous to the commitText() call, but for rich content. InputContentInfo contains an URI that identifies the content in a content provider. Your app can then request permission and read the content from the URI.
        Parameters:
        inputContentInfo - Content to be inserted.his value must never be null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
